isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB DOOR COMPONENTS DISASSEMBLY AND REASSEMBLY

svcsubsec.title: CAB DOOR COMPONENTS DISASSEMBLY AND REASSEMBLY

svcsubsecinfo.para: Doors used on the cab are of aluminum riveted construction with all components easily accessible if required. The components described in the following text are serviced with the door on the vehicle. If for any reason the door is removed from the vehicle and components need to be replaced, replace the components at this time. A piano type hinge is used and adjustment for these hinges is accomplished externally at elongated holes and shims on the door hinges.

svcproc.title: REMOVE DOOR

step1.para: Use a sling or padded chain through top of window opening and attach sling to overhead hoist to support door ( Figure 25).
Remove two screws and detach door restraint strap from door.

note.para: If door has electric-controlled windows, remove door mounted ashtray for access to cable connector. Disconnect wiring to remove door.

step1.para: Scribe position of door hinge to hinge pillar upper and lower corners of hinge; this will help when reinstalling the door. Remove six mounting bolts and detach hinge and door from hinge pillar.
Remove door to work bench or other support as required.

svcproc.para: Cover bench with a material that will not scratch paint surface of door.
